Description: Fragment of handle from a pottery transport amphora. Clay medium, light purplish brown; cream slip. Oval stamp at top of handle with Greek inscription and amphora symbol.
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 173, 2. This would seem to be an early Rhodian amphora, c.300 BC, since a very similar stamp apears on a Rhodian handles and neck fragment from Patara, E. Dundar, Transport Jars and Stamped Amphoras from Patara 7th to 1st Centuries BC, 84, Rh. 1.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1355)
